results.title: Albury: year round holiday centre
results.brief_description: A look at Albury, holiday and convention city, and its surrounding resorts. Shows the numerous amenities they can offer to the tourist or visitor. Points of interest seen are Lake Hume, Beechworth and its historic buildings and Mount Beauty and skiing at Falls Creek. No further credits available.

results.title: Alberta girls
results.creator_credit: Malca Gillson, Tony Ianzelo, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The film follows the Alberta All-girls drum and bugle band at the opening ceremonies of the World Cup Soccer Championship at Munich, Olympic Stadium, and their tour around Germany.

results.title: Albert Gleizes
results.creator_credit: Pierre Alibert and Les Films du Cypres
results.brief_description: Presents the painter who, early in his career, began experimenting with structure to rediscover form, which eventually led to Cubism. Successive treatments of one subject painted by Gleizes are compared in their cubistic development and the laws of painting, which Gleizes defined, are demonstrated through examples in his own work.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Pierre Alibert and Les Films du Cypres

results.title: Alaska: land in the balance
results.brief_description: Features the mountains, lakes, rivers, glaciers, wildlife and native people of Alaska. Raises the question of how these natural resources are to be preserved.

results.title: Aladdin and the magic lamp
results.creator_credit: lottie Reiniger Silhouette Films and Primrose Productions
results.brief_description: An extract from Lotte Reineger’s first major silhouette film, Prince Achmet, which had a great success among the avant-garde film movement when it was first released in Paris and Britain. This portion recounts the Arabian nights story of Aladdin. No other credits available.

results.title: Akiko: the life of a Japanese girl
results.brief_description: Shows a Japanese girl engaged in the study of the traditional japanese arts of drawing, painting, and using vegetable dyes. Shows how western lifestyle and culture is blending with the traditional Japanese way of life

results.title: Airport in the jet age
results.brief_description: A boy has an adventure through the reading of a book, one that takes him in a helicopter to the airport. There he checks in, boards his jet airliner, and takes off. No trouble at all, it seems. But then the film takes us back to watch the scores of people who work together to make this take-off possible.

results.title: Airplanes: how they fly
results.creator_credit: Hal Kopel and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Two children learn from a model airplane enthusiast how an airplane’s wings keep it in the air and how the propeller makes it move forward. The children go for an airplane ride and the pilot demonstrates the controls and explains how they work.

results.title: An Airman remembers: recollections by Sir Gordon Taylor
results.creator_credit: Cecil Holmes, K Porteous and ABC
results.brief_description: The history of aviation in Australia, recounting the achievements of such men as Kingsford- Smith, Hargrave, Hart, Ross Smith, Taylor, and indicating the trails they blazed.
